responsibilities_section:
Prowadzenie i koordynacja regularnego monitoringu i raportowania ryzyka dotyczącego jakości sprzedaży, wyłudzeń oraz braku zgodności.
Prowadzenie procesów wyjaśniania zgłoszonych zdarzeń oraz zidentyfikowanych anomalii w zakresie ryzyka dotyczącego jakości sprzedaży, wyłudzeń oraz braku zgodności.
Proaktywna optymalizacja systemów, procesów i procedur w zakresie ryzyka dotyczącego jakości sprzedaży, wyłudzeń oraz braku zgodności w celu identyfikacji, oceny i ograniczania tego ryzyka.
Aktywny udział w ustalonych projektach i inicjatywach w Prudential dotyczących zmian w systemach, procesach i procedurach w zakresie przeciwdziałania przestępczości finansowej oraz ryzyka dotyczącego braku zgodności, w tym także współpraca z innymi Zespołami w Prudential.
requirements_section:
2-5 lat doświadczenie w pracy w obszarze Compliance lub Kontroli Wewnętrznej.
Bardzo dobra znajomość MS Excel oraz Power BI – warunek konieczny.
Znajomość języka angielskiego – warunek konieczny.
Wykształcenie wyższe – preferowane kierunki: ekonometria, finanse, zarządzanie, ekonomia lub pokrewne.
Wysokie umiejętności analityczne i ustrukturyzowane podejście do rozwiązywania problemów.
Kreatywność i dociekliwość oraz dobra organizacja pracy, w tym jakość i terminowość.
Umiejętność pracy w grupie oraz w środowisku wielozadaniowym, w tym pod presją czasu.
optional_section: Znajomość programowania w Python lub R.

responsibilities_section:
You’ll work as part of a Workday technical team of problem solvers with extensive technical and industry experience, helping PwC territories solve their complex business issues from strategy to execution. Specific responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Develop brand new or enhance/support existing Workday Extend Applications/Integration based on business requirements and following best practices.
Create detailed application/integration specification and data dictionary
Work with solution architects, business stakeholders and functional product owners to gather business requirements of internal client’s projects
Be actively involved in global standardization through automation and innovation
Contribute to the development of your own and team's technical acumen
requirements_section:
Minimum diploma degree in technology or equivalent is required
2+ years of previous experience in software development work and 3+ years of Workday technical integration experience
Strong communication, presentation and relationship building skills
Experience with iterative or agile software development methodologies
Strong understanding of cloud SaaS architecture principles and integration patterns
Working in a global/virtual team environment
Demonstrating strong background and familiarity with: API concepts (SOAP & REST), XML, XSLT 3.0, JSON, oAuth 2.0, encryption/secure transfers methods, hands-on experience with at least one programming language (Java, Javascript, C#, Python)
Prior experience in the following Workday integration technologies: Workday Studio, Report as a Service, WQL, WWS and Workday REST API, Orchestrate, PMD Scripting, Graph API (nice to have), Workday Connectors, EIBs and DT.
Demonstrating familiarity with Workday HCM, Benefits, Talent Management, Recruiting and Security configuration or hands-on experience with testing functional aspects of delivered solutions.
Prior experience in building Extend Applications or delivering complex Workday integrations in global deployment environments
Prior hands-on experience with data analysis, PoC, middleware and problem solving
Solid understanding of security and data privacy standards, data governance and Extend app/Integration systems development standards and best practices
optional_section: Integration Core, Extend, Studio or Pro equivalent of Consulting certificates.

Demonstrating strong background and familiarity with: API concepts (SOAP & REST), XML, XSLT 3.0, JSON, oAuth 2.0, encryption/secure transfers methods, hands-on experience with at least one programming language (Java, Javascript, C#, Python)
Prior experience in the following Workday integration technologies: Workday Studio, Report as a Service, WQL, WWS and Workday REST API, Orchestrate, PMD Scripting, Graph API (nice to have), Workday Connectors, EIBs and DT.
Demonstrating familiarity with Workday HCM, Benefits, Talent Management, Recruiting and Security configuration or hands-on experience with testing functional aspects of delivered solutions.
Prior experience in building Extend Applications or delivering complex Workday integrations in global deployment environments
Prior hands-on experience with data analysis, PoC, middleware and problem solving
Solid understanding of security and data privacy standards, data governance and Extend app/Integration systems development standards and best practices
optional_section: Integration Core, Extend, Studio or Pro equivalent of Consulting certificates.

responsibilities_section:
You’ll work as part of a Workday technical team of problem solvers with extensive technical and industry experience, helping PwC territories solve their complex business issues from strategy to execution. Specific responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Develop brand new or enhance/support existing Workday Extend Applications/Integration based on business requirements and following best practices.
Create detailed application/integration specification and data dictionary
Work with solution architects, business stakeholders and functional product owners to gather business requirements of internal client’s projects
Be actively involved in global standardization through automation and innovation
Contribute to the development of your own and team's technical acumen
requirements_section:
Minimum diploma degree in technology or equivalent is required
2+ years of previous experience in software development work and 3+ years of Workday technical integration experience
Strong communication, presentation and relationship building skills
Experience with iterative or agile software development methodologies
Strong understanding of cloud SaaS architecture principles and integration patterns
Working in a global/virtual team environment
Demonstrating strong background and familiarity with: API concepts (SOAP & REST), XML, XSLT 3.0, JSON, oAuth 2.0, encryption/secure transfers methods, hands-on experience with at least one programming language (Java, Javascript, C#, Python)
Prior experience in the following Workday integration technologies: Workday Studio, Report as a Service, WQL, WWS and Workday REST API, Orchestrate, PMD Scripting, Graph API (nice to have), Workday Connectors, EIBs and DT.
Demonstrating familiarity with Workday HCM, Benefits, Talent Management, Recruiting and Security configuration or hands-on experience with testing functional aspects of delivered solutions.
Prior experience in building Extend Applications or delivering complex Workday integrations in global deployment environments
Prior hands-on experience with data analysis, PoC, middleware and problem solving
Solid understanding of security and data privacy standards, data governance and Extend app/Integration systems development standards and best practices
optional_section: Integration Core, Extend, Studio or Pro equivalent of Consulting certificates.

position_name: Associate Customer Success Manager with German
location:
Śląska 23/25, Działki Leśne, Gdynia
Gdynia, Pomeranian
responsibilities_section:
Work closely with customers to help them use LSEG products efficiently and effectively
Engage with clients by utilising customised digital workflow classes
Provide clients with additional learning on LSEG solutions by utilising digital learning materials, on-demand videos and academy classes
Educate customers on LSEG products and content functionality to increase product usage on client’s end
Analyse product usage information with focus on “at risk” customers to mitigate cancellations and identify value optimization opportunities
Collect customer experience feedback and share with relevant teams internally to support implementation of content or functionality changes
Develop and implement retention strategies as part of the customer's success plan, in partnership with Account Managers
Identify and investigate opportunities to raise to Account Manager for action and share insights to support the sales process
80% of time customer facing (virtual)
requirements_section:
A master’s degree in financial Markets, Economics, Business or similar topic
Strong interpersonal skills with problem solver instincts
Strong customer service skills
Strong presentation & communication skills both verbal & written
Willingness to keep on learning and developing yourself while sharing this knowledge
English + GERMAN (required)
optional_section:
Had Financial Market Knowledge in one of the following domains: Trading, Investment Banking, Commodities & Energy, Wealth, Investment Management or Forex/Money Market and ideally in Digital Marketing
Had programming experience (Python)
Were fluent in Spanish or Italian

location:
Powstańców Wielkopolskich 13G, Podgórze, Kraków
Kraków, Lesser Poland
responsibilities_section:
As a member of Aon’s Graduate ‘Launch’ programme, you will have the opportunity to participate in business sponsored projects and network with a large cohort of Graduates across the Europe, Middle East and Africa (EMEA) region.
You will gain exposure to all aspects of our business through in-role learning opportunities, participation in Agile scrum-based projects and the opportunity to work with key partners across the Aon business, gaining knowledge and insight into our world of data and analytics.
You will have the opportunity to learn or extend your knowledge in the field of Python, SQL, Scala programming language or learn about the latest solutions available on the market such as databricks, snowflake, aws cloud solution and more.
requirements_section:
Technical knowledge of SQL, Python or Scala would be advantageous.
Ability to think creatively and come up with unique, original ideas.
Teammate – data engineering requires cross-functional collaboration to move from concept to commercial data driven products.
Self-motivated and enthusiastic, with excellent interpersonal skills.
Self-organized, effective in managing your own time.
Pitching and storytelling – potential to communicate to partners in a compelling way.
Ethics and privacy – ability to think deeply with regard to ethical consequences of work.

responsibilities_section:
specyfikacja i analizowanie wymagań klientów wewnętrznych,

umiejętność specyfikacji i analizowania wymagań funkcjonalnych oraz technicznych (min. kontakt z klientem, umiejętność analizy kodu pod względem spełnienia wymagań funkcjonalnych),
doświadczenie w programowaniu np. Python, C++, Java (ze względu na prototypowanie),
znajomość zagadnień sieciowych IP,
kompetencje miękkie: gotowość do nauki i łatwość w uczeniu się, umiejętności planowania, organizowania spotkań, przewodzenia grupie,
umiejętność swobodnej komunikacji pisemnej i słownej w języku angielskim.
optional_section:
znajomość DPDK (lub środowisk czasu rzeczywistego)
doświadczenie w zakresie troubleshootingu i/lub wirtualizacji,
doświadczenie w zakresie testowania, testów modułowych, testów E2E oraz umiejętność interpretowania wyników,
doświadczenie w pracy z warstwą danych (User Plane), zarówno po stronie UE, jak i CN,
wiedza na temat systemu operacyjnego Linux oraz sieci,
doświadczenie z natywnymi rozwiązaniami chmurowymi oraz infrastrukturą (mikroserwisy, Docker, Kubernetes),
znajomość procesów Continuous Integration,
znajomość protokołów TCP/IP.

responsibilities_section:
Development aplikacji nocode od podstaw (web oraz mobile), z naciskiem na backend, a także utrzymanie i rozwój dotychczasowych rozwiązań.
Fakultatywnie możliwość rozwoju także frontendu.
Współpraca z 10-osobowym teamem (CTO, QA, PM, Designer, Developerzy NoCode).
Udział w code reviews.
Branie udziału w spotkaniach z klientami (krajowi, Europa, USA).

Język angielski na poziomie umożliwiającym swobodną komunikację z międzynarodowymi klientami (co najmniej B2).
Dostępność do współpracy full-time.
Gotowość do przekwalifikowania się na NoCode Developera.
Dostępność na sporadyczne spotkania z klientami z USA w godzinach wieczornych.

Szybka dostępność (ASAP lub miesięczny okres wypowiedzenia), lecz akceptowany są także dłuższe okresy wypowiedzenia.

location:
Leona Kruczkowskiego 8, Śródmieście, Warszawa
Warszawa, Masovian
responsibilities_section:
Join our dynamic and innovative Data, Systems & Analytics team at Baxter Integrated Supply Chain (Global Planning) as a Regional Systems & Analytics Analyst. You will play a crucial role in supporting the development and deployment of data management, reporting, and analytical instruments. Your expertise in Power BI, Tableau, and application development will be utilized to extend access to data and analytics, providing a significant business advantage. If you have a strong background in supply chain reporting and analytics and possess excellent problem-solving and communication skills, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity.
What will you be doing?
•Collaborating with the analytical management team to gather and harmonize business and system requirements for the global supply chain application database.
•Translating business requirements into impactful Tableau reports that provide actionable insights.
•Developing executive-level dashboards using Tableau storyboards to visualize key performance indicators.
•Assisting the Program Manager and development team in planning each release, ensuring adherence to release controls and documentation.
•Coordinating with the deployment team to prepare and review communications to stakeholders, ensuring a smooth deployment process.
•Troubleshooting and resolving application issues arising from global reporting, identifying data implications and risks.
•Resolving Help-Desk tickets, requests, bugs, and actions promptly and with a sense of urgency and priority.
requirements_section:
•A candidate with a degree in Computer Science, Management Engineering, or equivalent, with more than 3 years of experience in application development focusing on reporting and analytics within the supply chain domain.
•Person with strong understanding of supply chain-oriented measures and systems, including inventory, demand, production planning, distribution planning, ERP systems, and planning techniques.
•Proficient User in Tableau, Power BI, or similar systems, with a proven track record of successful implementation.
•Experience in programming languages such as C#, Python, or R will be added value.
•Analyst with excellent data reporting and analytical skills, with the ability to conduct root-cause analyses.
•Good application of data risk management practices and attention to detail and accuracy.
•Process-driven mindset, with the ability to work independently, deliver results within assigned timelines, and prioritize tasks effectively.
•Excellent proficiency in the English language, both written and verbal.

responsibilities_section:
Designing, developing, and deploying Azure-based AI solutions, including machine learning models, cognitive services, and data analytics solutions.
Collaborating with cross-functional teams, such as data scientists, business analysts, and developers, to design and implement AI solutions that meet business requirements.
Building and training machine learning models using Azure Machine Learning, and tuning models for optimal performance.
Developing and deploying custom AI models using Azure Cognitive Services, such as speech recognition, language understanding, and computer vision.
Creating data pipelines to collect, process, and prepare data for analysis and modeling using Azure data services, such as Azure Data Factory and Azure Databricks.
Implementing data analytics solutions using Azure Synapse Analytics or other Azure data services.
Deploying and managing Azure services and resources using Azure DevOps or other deployment tools.
Monitoring and troubleshooting deployed solutions to ensure optimal performance and reliability.
Ensuring compliance with security and regulatory requirements related to AI solutions.
Staying up-to-date with the latest Azure AI technologies and industry developments, and sharing knowledge and best practices with the team.
requirements_section:
Overall 5+ years’ combined experience in IT and recent 3 years as AI engineer.
Bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, information technology, or a related field.
Experience in designing, developing, and delivering successful AI Services.
Experience with cloud computing technologies, such as AWS or Azure, is desirable.
Relevant industry certifications, such as Microsoft Certified: Azure AI Engineer, Azure Solution Architect etc. is a plus.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams and communicate technical information to non-technical stakeholders.
You are open to occasional business travels and on site team meetings
Proficiency in programming languages: You should be proficient in programming language such as Python and R.
Experience of Azure AI services: You should have experience with Azure AI services such as Azure Machine Learning, Azure Cognitive Services, and Azure Databricks.
Data handling and processing: You should be proficient in data handling and processing techniques such as data cleaning, data normalization, and feature extraction. Knowledge of SQL, NoSQL, and big data technologies such as Hadoop and Spark are also beneficial.
Experience with Cloud platform: You should have a good understanding of cloud computing concepts and experience working with Azure services such as containers, Kubernetes, Web Apps, Azure Front Door, CDN, Web Application firewalls etc.
DevOps and CI/CD: You should be familiar with DevOps practices and CI/CD pipelines. This includes tools such as Azure DevOps & Git.
Security and compliance: You should be aware of security and compliance considerations when building and deploying AI models in the cloud. This includes knowledge of Azure security services, compliance frameworks such as HIPAA and GDPR, and best practices for securing data and applications in the cloud.
Machine learning algorithms and frameworks: Knowledge of machine learning algorithms and frameworks such as TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, and Scikit-learn is a plus.

responsibilities_section:
You are part of our international team that owns the complete lifecycle (Plan, Build, Run) of the global Bosch Backbone with our continental routing hubs, Internet/Cloud-Peering & Software-Defined WAN Infrastructure for all Bosch Locations
As a Lead Developer, you actively collect & maintain requirements for automation of our networking infrastructure
In close collaboration with our Network Architects and -Engineers, you identify potential use-cases for automation & configuration/status verification to ensure quality and efficiency gains
You are responsible to design, build, maintain and run the automation solution and make them accessible and usable to our colleagues and customers
requirements_section:
Bachelor degree in the IT area
Multiple years of experience in software development (Requirements Engineering, Conception, Development & Testing)
Experience with the methods, practices and tools in the area of IT automation (e.g. Git, Ansible, Puppet, Python, CI/CD)
Knowledge of networking fundamentals & concepts is preferrable
Creative drive & goal-oriented , open-minded personality
Good communicator & willing to work in an international team
Language: English, advanced Level

Good written and spoken technical English, allowing trouble-free communication
optional_section: Strong API test automation experience

location:
Łużycka 8c, Mały Kack, Gdynia
Gdynia, Pomeranian
responsibilities_section:
Example target projects: design or assist in the design and development of the Mosaic One SaaS product; design or assist in the design and development of CI pipeline infrastructure needed to carry out build and test requirements for Mosaic One.
Perform or assist in high-level and low-level software design and implementation of new modules and enhancements to existing software.
Perform or assist in feasibility studies of needed software development.
Document the design including features definition and architecture.
Conduct and participate in design reviews and code reviews.
Plan and perform unit and system level testing of implemented software modules and enhancements.
Help fix software bugs found during all testing phases.
Work with team to deploy and test incremental software releases.
Organize and coordinate development activities within schedule and product constraints.
Other projects and assignments may result and be assigned to accommodate the changing needs of the department and the Company.
requirements_section:
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, Computer Information Science, Electrical Engineering, or equivalent education required.
At least 6 years of active experience.
Experience with software design, implementation and debugging including inter-process communication and multi-threading techniques is required.
A solid foundation in computer science, with strong competencies in data structures, algorithms, and software engineering.
Experience with Python.
Experience with testing and development tools such as pyTest.
Experience with Test Driven Development and Unit Test Frameworks.
Excellent teamwork abilities.
At least B1 English proficiency level.
optional_section:
Experience with Python3.
Experience with cloud deployments such as AWS.
Familiarity with Ethernet and networking protocols.
Experience with coding and scripting in Angular, JavaScript, TypeScript, CSS.
Experience with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) such as Terraform, CloudFormation/SAM.

position_name: Expert in Capital Adequacy and Stress Testing
responsibilities_section:
Calculating, analyzing and reporting risk figures for regulatory, economic and accounting purposes
Implementing new requirements coming from business departments and regulators with regards to risk figures calculation and reporting
Performing EBA benchmarking exercise and Basel IV Quantitative Impact Study
Doing impact analysis, e.g. for checking possible strategic actions
Performing stress tests on risk figures, including impact analysis on RWA and loan loss provisions
Being involved in reporting chain (interface to finance department)
Ensuring data quality of inputs and outputs regarding risk figures calculation
requirements_section:
Master or Bachelor degree in economics, finance & accounting, IT or related field
Several years of experience in credit risk controlling
Profound knowledge in capital adequacy, stress testing or credit risk (e.g. CRR)
Strong willingness to troubleshoot
A good acquaintance of MS Office tools – Excel and Word
Basic knowledge of technical languages like SQL, VBA or Python and databases
Good communication and soft skills
English - fluent

required_technologies:

responsibilities_section:
Gathering, defining, and translating business requirements into specifications
Designing and creating data models in Power BI Premium based on a wide variety of source systems
Creating reports and dashboards for the Demand to Warehouse stream (Supply Chain)
Managing and maintaining the B1 HANA views
Acting as a driving force and a knowledgeable resource for JD Edwards
Maintaining and developing of existing solutions
Supporting of the Power BI community
Fulfilling business requirements against limited budget and time
Safeguarding the Power BI architecture
Developing in a team of developers and following team guidelines
requirements_section:
You have minimum 5 years of practical experience in creating reports in Power BI tools and Power BI Service (Data Flows, Linked Entities, Data Sets)
You are able to understand system complexity and translate technical concepts into solutions/applications
You have experience in data modelling and data model normalization
You have strong knowledge of DAX, SQL and Power Query M language. It's a plus if you also have experience with Python.
You have 3 years of experience with JD Edwards
You are familiar with Scrum and DevOps
You have experience with Azure and Data warehousing concepts is preferred
You are able to develop dashboards/ reports from multiple data sources
You are able to draw conclusions, escalate issues and define recommendations
You have fluency in English (written and spoken)
You have bachelors or Master's degree in IT/Finance
You have experience with Power BI Premium, SQL Management Studio, SAP SQL and Visual Studio

required_technologies:
Python
PyTorch
TensorFlow
Numpy
Pandas
Matplotlib
Git
responsibilities_section:
Develop and test Machine Learning tools for evaluation, data generation and model training.
Automate ML pipelines.
Work with perception layer of the AV/ADAS stack including LiDAR, camera, radar, ultrasonic, IMU and GPS sensors.
Develop perception algorithms for autonomous driving systems (object detection, classification and tracking).
Work with synthetic datasets based on simulation engines.
Develop algorithms and software to explore the rich world of autonomous vehicles operating conditions.
Work with time series data from connected and automated vehicles.
Develop novel detection anomalies solutions.
requirements_section:
University degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Computer Vision or related field (last year students are also welcome).
Good understanding of Machine Learning and Deep Learning concepts.
Solid software engineering skills in Python.
Practical experience with ML / Data Science related frameworks and libraries such as PyTorch, Tensorflow, Numpy, Pandas and Matplotlib.
Familiarity with collaboration tools and methods such as git or CI.
Excellent communication and teamwork skills.
At least C1 level of English in both writing and speaking in order to communicate with foreign clients.
optional_section:
Experience with cloud infrastructure, especially on AWS.

responsibilities_section:
Subject-matter-expert concerning climate risk modelling (both physical risk and transition risk) and the use of climate risk models for credit risk and financial stress testing.
Support initiatives to build out Climate Risk scenario analysis / stress testing capabilities covering Physical and Transition Risks, and for use in BAU client and transactional assessments.
Assess emerging Climate Risk scenarios (e.g. NGFS, IEA), climate stress testing industry practices and supervisory expectations and develop a roadmap for establishing in-house capabilities.
Support the evaluation of external vendor solutions to help fill gaps in internal data and/or analytical capabilities in the short run. Work collaboratively with vendors where necessary.
Work to develop climate scenarios as well as translate climate risk scenarios to macro-economic and market variables necessary for stress testing.
Work with Model Risk Management to ensure adherence to model risk policy requirements.
Collaborate with local teams to support the delivery of supervisory climate risk scenario analysis and stress testing as they emerge (e.g. Europe / UK / Asia).
Contribute to the broader Climate Risk team in building out best-in-class first line climate risk management capabilities.
Customize internal transition risk scenarios to help build and evolve the internal climate scenario framework.
Interrogate, assess and choose appropriate models from external parties, including vendors.
Establish requirements and work with Risk CDO and team in order to collect data on transition risk impacts and risk-related scenario analysis.
Where projects arise collaborate with our academic partners on research opportunities for developing bespoke climate risk modelling and represent the Bank at academic / industry working groups.
Support engagement with key footprint countries as well as risk and business stakeholders on the topic of Climate Risk. Ensure the model outputs are fit for purposes not only for regulatory purposes, scenario analysis and stress testing but also for daily business usage, underwriting decisions, risk appetite decisions and strategy design.
Assess the downstream impact of models to understand its network risk.
requirements_section:
Climate scenario development and scenario expansion modelling experience or knowledge of Risk modelling within a financial services setting.
Familiarity with conventional transition scenario modelling and tools, including Integrated Assessment Models (IAMs), Simulation Models and Probabilistic Models.
Familiarity with the increasing regulatory expectations facing banks with respect to climate risk
Knowledge of financial products.
Excellent analytical skills and comfortable working with large datasets; expertise in econometrics and other quantitative methods is highly desirable.
Experience in dealing with change projects and/or building / delivering new capabilities.
Experience of liaising across diverse stakeholder groups; including senior managers, and large firm networks.
Experience in developing or validating quantitative models (at least 5 years) in areas related to climate risk.
Climate Risk model development experience in a Financial/Insurance industry setting.
Home and Host Regulatory Framework and Requirements: Awareness and understanding of the regulatory framework in which the firm operates.
Good knowledge of banking risk management, a knowledge of Basel/CRR/EBA/IFRS 9 regulations and standards.
Understanding of Corporate, Institutional, and Commercial & Retail portfolios and products.
Strong academic background (PhD is preferable) in a highly quantitative discipline, including economics, stats or math's.
Understanding of application of climate risk models, climate science and the key issues that surrounds climate risk areas.
Strong programming skills (Python, R, SAS, SQL, VBA, etc.).
The candidate should be highly motivated to rapidly advance the firm's plan to establish a comprehensive climate risk management framework against an ambitious timeline.
Strong communication and project management skills.
Strong focus on quality control and attention to detail.
Analytical and independent thinker.
Excellent attention to detail and good time management.
Initiative, creativity and problem solving.

responsibilities_section:

Supporting deep-dive data analysis to investigate any (data) issues.
Performing analyses of both input and output datasets in Dataiku to access business impact

Conducting research and effectively communicating validation findings to the team as well as suggesting possible solutions.
Maintaining and updating business mappings & logic.
Analysing data extracts from source systems and validating business requirements; working with Data Engineers to enhance the extracts.
Document all underlying business mapping methodologies, design, assumptions, and exceptions.
Helping the team to translate business analytical needs into data requirement / data model, working with technology Data Engineers to design the relevant data extracts as inputs to models and solutions.
Working with product owner to create business logic / mapping for stitching multiple different sets of data together and / or add business-related attributes.
Working with technology to build and maintain the relevant database / tables based on the agreed architecture.

requirements_section:
2-3 years of experience in data analysis, data architecture, data transformations, building end-to-end inhouse data flows (pipes) from source to output, preferably in a bank environment.
Master's degree in Finance, Economics, Engineering, Data Science, Mathematics or similar.
Good knowledge of Python and SQL (other languages advantageous).
Outstanding analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, open-minded and willing to learn new skills (both business and technical knowledge).
Previous experience in end-to-end data extraction, ETL, transformation, and MI building.
Prior exposure to Treasury/Risk/Finace in any of the areas: liquidity, interest rate, FTP, capital / RWA and asset / liability management, and ideally with some understanding on balance sheet and banking products.
Previous experience working in an agile environment.

Role Specific Technical Competencies: Interest Rate Risk - earnings (NII) and value (EVE, PV01); Liquidity cashflow mismatch; LCR, NSFR and other regulatory metrics; Bank funding; Funds Transfer Pricing (FTP); Liquidity ratios such as LDR, deposit concentration etc.; ALM and Commercial Book products; Understanding of Bank systems architecture; JIRA/Confluence; Python/R programming; SQL; Solution design and validation; End User testing / computation; Data Analysis; Data Design; Excel.

responsibilities_section:
Translate business requirements into data requirement / data model, working with technology Data Engineers to design the relevant data extracts as inputs to models and solutions.
Analyse data extracts from source systems and validate if meets business requirements; working with Data Engineers to enhance the extracts.
Working with product owner to create business logic / mapping for stitching multiple different sets of data together and / or add business-related attributes.
Implement end to end data flow (pipes) in the in-house platform from raw data extract to final results table. This includes ETL, any transformations / stitching of different data set and enrichment with business logic.
Working with technology to build and maintain the relevant database / tables based on the agreed architecture.
Maintain and update all key tables for business mappings & logics.
Excel (VBA) prototyping work on forecasting using the data set.
Independently conduct deep-dive data analysis to investigate any issues.
Propose, create, and deliver business-oriented MI to share with wider business audiences. Run period process to ensure product of these MI (i.e. monthly).
Document all underlying business mapping methodologies, design, assumptions and exceptions.
requirements_section:
3-5 years of experience in data analysis, data architecture, data transformations, building end to end inhouse data flows (pipes) from source to output, preferably in a bank environment.
Master's degree in Finance Economics, Engineering, Mathematics or similar, fresh graduates / final year students with relevant major and outstanding academic record will be also considered.
Good knowledge of Python, VBA and SQL (other languages advantageous) and Excel.
Outstanding analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, open-minded and willing to learn new skills (both business and technical knowledge).
Previous experience in end to end data extraction, ETL, transformation and MI building - good to have.
Previous experience working in an agile environment - good to have.
Understanding and practical experience in liquidity risk, ALM, banking products and/or balance sheet optimization - good to have.
Prior experience with Dataiku data platform or with Balance Sheet Management platforms (Moody's Analytics, RiskPro, QRM, Oracle, etc.) or booking platforms (Murex, Kondor, etc.) - good to have.
Role Specific Competencies: Liquidity ratios such as LDR, deposit concentration etc., ALM and Commercial Book products, Understanding of Bank systems architecture, Python/R programming, SQL, Excel VBA, Solution design and validation, User testing / computation, Data Analysis, Data Design.

Knowledge of tools supporting development such as Jira, Git, VMWare, Test Management etc.,
Practical knowledge of Logix Architecture and Studio 5000,
Basic knowledge of NI LabVIEW.

responsibilities_section:
Create Test Plans and Test Specification with Test Cases,
Verification of Firmware functionalities of Industrial Components products,
Develop and maintain Test Automation for the projects (Python and NI LabVIEW,
Review of documentation and Product Requirements Documents and have influence on testability and functionality of the product,
Maintain product documentation in ALM Tools (Jira, Jama and qTest)
Provide regular feedback to Development and Product Management regarding product quality,
Design and maintain Firmware Test Setups which includes PLCs, communication gateways, virtual machines, Rockwell Software, measurement equipment and other devices,
requirements_section:
Education in Automation, Electronics or similar
Min.2 years of professional experience in Industrial Automation and/or Firmware Testing area,
Strong practical knowledge of Python scripting language,
Knowledge of PLCs and Industrial Automation
Familiarity with industrial communication protocols such as EtherNet/IP
Good communication skills, along with the ability to read, write, and speak English fluently and with people at all levels,
Analytical mindset to manage day to day work with documentation,
Ability to work independently.
optional_section:
Experience with PLC System Configuration,
Knowledge of Firmware Development methodologies such as V-Model, Waterfall, Kanban, Scrum,
Knowledge of tools supporting development such as Jira, Git, VMWare, Test Management etc.,
Practical knowledge of Logix Architecture and Studio 5000,
Basic knowledge of NI LabVIEW.

type_of_work: full office work, home office work, hybrid work
responsibilities_section:
Participate in project planning, setting priorities, and defining the work schedule
Responsible for monitoring project progress and ensuring that goals are achieved within the specified timeframe
Manage the software development team
Collaboration with other team members to coordinate activities and resolve issues/Ongoing collaboration with the rest of the team (code reviews, coordinating development efforts, discussings solutions)
Building new features and integrating them with existing codebase
Research and implementation of new technologies
Work-logging time spent in a dedicated tool - Everhour
Updating status of work in Management Tools
Learning. Everyday.
requirements_section:
At least 5 years experience in developing web applications
At least 5 years experience with Python
Leadership and managerial skills
Good understanding of principles and best practices of Python programming
Experience in building scalable project architectures
Very good communication skills, teamwork oriented, work organization
Optimistic, charismatic and don't be afraid to take action
Experience in building REST APIs
Working knowledge of PostgreSQL (or other RDBMS)
Working knowledge of Django
Good command of GIT
Analytical thinking
Speaking and writing in English (B2 or above)

position_name: Konsultant w Zespole Analizy Danych (Data Analytics) w Zespole Zarządzania Ryzykiem Technologicznym
location:
rondo ONZ 1, Śródmieście, Warszawa
Warszawa, mazowieckie
responsibilities_section:
Udział w projektach z zakresu zarządzania ryzykiem, zgodnością regulacyjną i optymalizacją procesów biznesowych z wykorzystaniem metod analizy danych,
Zarządzanie 2-3 osobowymi zespołami
Tworzenie kompleksowych analiz w celu określenia i interpretowania trendów lub wzorców w złożonych zbiorach danych,
Wykorzystywanie platform analitycznych oraz rekomendowanie i budowanie nowych rozwiązań w zakresie danych,
Analiza procesów oraz zbieranie wymagań biznesowych oraz wymagań dotyczących danych do projektów biznesowej analizy danych i raportowania,
Tworzenie wysokiej jakości raportów wykorzystywanych do podejmowania decyzji i działań biznesowych.
requirements_section:
Znajomość podstaw środowisk bazodanowych, pakietów statystycznych lub języków programowania (np. Python, R, SAS, SQL, VBA),
Wiedza w zakresie podstawowych metod statystycznych uzyskana w ramach zajęć na studiach,
Bardzo dobra znajomość języka polskiego i angielskiego w mowie i piśmie,
Dobra znajomość MS Excel oraz innych programów pakietu MS Office,
Min. 2-letnie doświadczenie na projektach z praktycznym aspektami modelowania i analizy danych,
Wyższe wykształcenie (preferowane kierunki: matematyka, fizyka, informatyka, ekonomia/ekonometria, metody ilościowe bądź pokrewne kierunki ścisłe)
Wcześniejsze doświadczenie zawodowe w obszarze bankowości, zarządzania ryzykiem czy analityki danych,
Doświadczenie w budowie lub walidacji modeli ilościowych.

type_of_work: praca stacjonarna, praca zdalna, praca hybrydowa
responsibilities_section:
czynny udział w procesach budowy modeli ryzyka kredytowego, w tym zgodnych z wymogami IFRS9 oraz IRB
analiza jakości działania modeli, wskazywanie kierunku ich rozwoju i poprawy
utrzymywanie istniejących modeli statystycznych wykorzystywanych w procesie szacowania ryzyka kredytowego
interakcje z interesariuszami (użytkownicy biznesowi, walidacja, KNF)
requirements_section:
przynajmniej 2 lata doświadczenia w modelowaniu ryzyka kredytowego w ujęciu regulacyjnym (PD, EAD, LGD, stress testy) i/lub nieregulacyjnym
ukończenie studiów (przynajmniej licencjat/inżynier) w zakresie ekonometrii, metod ilościowych, statystyki, matematyki, fizyki
znajomość miar do zarządzania ryzykiem kredytowym
wiedza, gdzie szukać wytycznych regulacyjnych (m.in. CRR, EBA GL, IFRS9, rekomendacje KNF)
doświadczenie w programowaniu w SAS lub podobnych narzędziach (SQL, Python, R)
rozwinięte umiejętności analityczne
komunikatywność, entuzjazm, determinacja, umiejętność pacy w dynamicznym otoczeniu
średnio-zaawansowana znajomość j. angielskiego - poziom B2
optional_section:
praktyczna znajomość zaawansowanych technik modelowania, takich jak uogólnione techniki ekonometryczne, modelowanie szeregów czasowych, metody ML uczenia z nadzorem i bez nadzoru
rozumienie zależności ryzyka kredytowego z innymi obszarami działalności bankowej oraz umiejętność współpracowania z pracownikami tych obszarów
sprawne poruszanie się w środowiskach bazodanowych
aktywne uczestniczenie w społecznościach dedykowanych modelowaniu lub/i ryzyku kredytowemu

analiza jakości działania modeli, wskazywanie kierunku ich rozwoju i poprawy
zarządzanie ryzykiem modeli zapewniające odpowiedni monitoring procesów ich budowy i użycia, zgodność z regulacjami wewnętrznymi i zewnętrznymi
interakcje z interesariuszami (użytkownicy biznesowi, walidacja, KNF)
requirements_section:
przynajmniej 5 lat doświadczenia w modelowaniu ryzyka kredytowego w ujęciu regulacyjnym (PD, EAD, LGD, stress testy) i/lub nieregulacyjnym
ukończone studia (mgr lub doktor) w zakresie ekonometrii, metod ilościowych, statystyki, matematyki, fizyki
znajomość regulacji oraz technik z obszaru modelowania ryzyka kredytowego (IRB, CRR, EBA GL, IFRS9 i rekomendacje KNF)
doświadczenie w programowaniu w SAS lub podobnych narzędziach (SQL, Python, R)
znajomość zasad zarządzania ryzykiem kredytowym
wysoko rozwinięte umiejętności analitycznego myślenia
odpowiedzialność za realizowane zadania
zaawansowana znajomość j. angielskiego - poziom C1
optional_section:
praktyczna znajomość zaawansowanych technik modelowania, takich jak uogólnione techniki ekonometryczne, modelowanie szeregów czasowych, modelowanie bayesowskie, metody symulacyjne, sieci neuronowe, metody ML uczenia z nadzorem i bez nadzoru
rozumienie zależności ryzyka kredytowego z innymi obszarami działalności bankowej oraz umiejętność współpracowania z pracownikami tych obszarów
sprawne poruszanie się w środowiskach bazo-danowych
aktywne uczestniczenie w społecznościach dedykowanych modelowaniu lub/i ryzyku kredytowemu

position_name: Analityk ds. popytu i podaży KSE (k/m)
responsibilities_section:
opracowywanie założeń rozwoju otoczenia regulacyjnego, makroekonomicznego, społecznego i środowiskowego na potrzeby planowania rozwoju KSE oraz innych procesów planistycznych oraz optymalizacyjnych
prowadzenie działań i/lub wsparcie przedstawicieli PSE w pracach ENTSO-E w zakresie wybranych obszarów współpracy
udział w procesie opracowywania prognoz popytowych na moc i energię elektryczną w KSE w perspektywie średnio i długoterminowej
udział w procesie oceny stanu bezpieczeństwa dostarczania energii elektrycznej w KSE w zakresie wystarczalności zasobów wytwórczych w perspektywie wieloletniej
przygotowanie założeń i wykonywanie analiz dotyczących optymalizacji struktury paliwowej wytwarzania energii elektrycznej
prowadzenie baz danych dotyczących sektora wytwarzania energii elektrycznej i zapotrzebowania na energię elektryczną

Postman
SoapUI
Jira
Confluence
SQL
responsibilities_section:
Projektowanie, tworzenie, przeprowadzanie i utrzymanie testów automatycznych oprogramowania – testy regresyjne, integracyjne (REST, SOAP), wydajnościowe,
Utworzenie frameworka i zarządzanie środowiskami do testów automatycznych,
Wsparcie w instalacji i konfiguracji narzędzi do automatyzacji testów,
Monitoring i optymalizacja procesu automatyzacji testów,
Tworzenie, analiza oraz wybór scenariuszy do testów regresji,
Weryfikacja jakości skryptów automatycznych (Review) i dokumentacji testowej dostarczonej przez inne osoby z zespołu oraz klientów biznesowych,
Przygotowywanie danych testowych, tworzenie zaślepek, mock’ów,
Utrzymanie repozytorium dokumentacji testowej i artefaktów testowych, danych testowych,
Sporadyczne wykonywanie testów manualnych – w razie potrzeby.
requirements_section:
Minimum 5 lat doświadczenia w dziedzinie automatyzacji testów,
Znajomość języka programowania Python,
Znajomość następujących narzędzi: Selenium 4.6, Request, Behave, BitBucket, Jenkins, TeamCity, Gatling, JMetter, Postman lub SoapUI, Jira, Confluence,
Praktyczne doświadczenie w budowaniu frameworków automatyzacji testów regresji, API i wydajnościowych,
Znajomość relacyjnych baz danych i języka SQL,
Znajomość procesów CI/CD,
Wiedza domenowa w zakresie metod testowania, technologii, procesów testowych,
Znajomość procesów związanych z testami manualnymi oprogramowania,
Doświadczenie we współpracy w ramach metodyk zwinnych (SCRUM),
Gotowość do sporadycznych wizyt w biurze - zespół spotyka się 2x w miesiącu w biurze klienta w Warszawie.

responsibilities_section:
Design and development of cutting-edge, innovative, powerful reporting and analytics solutions
Advise and deliver state-of-the-art data visualizations, including preparations of proof of concepts
Collect dashboard and report requirements, explore large datasets, execute data preparation & data blending procedures and create data models/sets
Improvement of existing solutions to ensure consistency and cohesiveness across all data analytics applications
Participate in strategic cross-domain projects that require analytics and business acumen
Participate in large-scale digital transformation programs working with international teams and collaborating with the brightest minds across many industries.
requirements_section:
Minimum bachelor’s degree preferably in business domains and/or computer science
Sound knowledge of management reporting concepts for enterprise functions
Experience in design and implementation of reporting & analytics solutions
Working knowledge with leading front-end business intelligence tools such as: Power BI with DAX, Tableau, Alteryx, Qlik, SAP Analytics Cloud
Familiarity with SQL, data warehousing, data modeling, predictive analytics concepts, data visualization methodologies and cloud based-solutions
English at professional level, additional proficiency in German or French is highly welcomed

responsibilities_section:
Acting as a risk management analyst while working with Accenture’s global teams to help clients develop cutting edge and industry leading solutions
Shaping Accenture’s thought capital around current and emerging risk management topics
Using your analytical & quantitative skills to provide clarity to complex issues and gather data as well as model driven insights
Helping clients use the new wave of technological risk innovations (Big Data & Cloud Solutions, Robotics, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning) to enhance and transform the risk management function
Working across a dynamic, international team where English is the common language
Traveling globally to work with prestigious clients and deliver large-scale transformational change.
requirements_section:
Quantification skills in one or more of the following risk domain areas: credit, market, liquidity, ALM, operational, ESG, ERM; knowledge of Basel III and IV principles and practices, ICAAP, MIFID, FRTB, GDPR, IFRS 9, etc.
Experience across risk platforms and technologies/products for example Bloomberg, Reuters, Murex, Algorithmics, Moody’s, eFront, OFSAA, etc.
Digitally savvy and conscious of new technologies; continuous learner; knowledge of programming languages (R, SAS, VBA, SQL, PYTHON) would be a great supplement
Industry certifications such as FRM, PRM, CQF, CFA are an asset
Team Player; enjoys the intellectual stimulation of collaborating with colleagues around the world
Proficient level in English and either Italian, German, Spanish or French (written & spoken)

Kraków, Lesser Poland
required_technologies:
AWS
Azure DevOps
Java
Spring Boot
PHP
Symfony
responsibilities_section:
Consultant Mindset: Embracing a consultant's approach, providing expert advice, proposing solutions that add value to the client's business, and being able to see the bigger picture beyond individual projects.
Requirements Gathering: Working closely with clients and internal teams to gather and analyze requirements for proposed solutions.
Client Workshops: Conducting and leading workshops with clients using methods like Event Storming to understand their needs and develop suitable solutions.
Project Estimation: Develop flexible project plans and estimates that take into account various factors such as project risks, assumptions, conflicting business needs, and company resources. Must be capable of managing these elements dynamically, ensuring that project delivery is not compromised while accommodating shifting business priorities. Should be skilled at consolidating this information into a coherent project proposal for the client.
System Architecture Design: Creating and documenting system architecture using methods like C4 diagrams. Make it understandable and attractive for clients, and be able to justify and explain the architectural decisions made.
Sales Support: Collaborating closely with the sales team, supporting the sales process, and ensuring client satisfaction through the effective demonstration of our technology and solutions.
Leadership: Lead and manage development teams, ensuring effective collaboration and execution of projects.
Continuous Improvement: Take the initiative to identify opportunities for process optimization, manage time effectively, and continually improve our practices and solutions.
Learning and Specialization: Keep abreast with the latest trends and developments in the EV and renewable technologies sector. Be willing to learn and specialize in these areas.
requirements_section:
Technical Skills:
Strong technical background in designing and developing cloud-based applications is necessary. Familiarity with cloud platforms like AWS or Azure is required. Experience with IoT is a plus.
Experience with architectural patterns such as modular monolith and asynchronous architecture. Ability to design systems that are cost-effective in development while being prepared for evolving requirements.
Proficiency in Java + Spring Boot or PHP + Symfony is preferred. We also regularly use .NET stack, Python and TypeScript.
Project Leadership Skills:
Proven experience in leading and managing development teams.
Experience with agile project management methodologies, including Kanban.
Experience managing project roadmaps, backlogs, prioritizing tasks, and guiding the team through the development cycle.
Sales Experience: A proven track record in a sales or pre-sales role is required. The candidate must feel comfortable leading the conversation with clients, have demonstrated their ability to support sales processes, effectively communicate the value proposition of technical products, and drive client satisfaction.
Communication Skills: Excellent written and verbal communication skills are critical. The candidate must have a demonstrated ability to effectively collaborate and communicate with clients, team members, and other stakeholders. They should also be comfortable leading and facilitating workshops and meetings.
Problem-Solving Skills and Mindset: Candidates should exhibit a "getting things done" attitude, coupled with a pragmatic approach to problem-solving. While precision and a high level of quality in work are required, they should also be able to strike a balance between perfection and efficiency.
Teamwork: Must be a strong team player, able to work effectively in a team-oriented setting, contributing to a positive and collaborative team environment.
Adaptability: As a "jack of all trades," candidates should be comfortable with a variety of tasks and challenges, displaying versatility in their skills and the ability to adapt to new situations.
Openness to travel: Workshops often take place at clients’ offices.

responsibilities_section:
Together with a few other engineers, you’ll help one of our clients with building data products. As an autonomous steam-aligned team, you might deal with a wide spectrum of tech from data warehouses, ETL/ELT pipelines, Event processing, and more.
Design & code defensively for the real world and not for the happy path “Hello World” scenarios. Buckle up as you know, missing, late and low-quality raw data is a fact, and pipeline failures and replay/re-process are usual, not a drama.
Your default is applying TDD to data engineering. You don’t deliver something that works sometimes/maybe. Got experience with Great Expectations platform or Deequ? Perfecto!
You’ll help with interviewing and selecting future engineers. We’ll train you on how to conduct effective interviews!
requirements_section:

Infrastructure as code skills. You like to connect over ssh to a production system, great you like bash, but this isn’t us
Solid computer science knowledge
Hands-on knowledge about Event-driven architectures
Experience with data modeling on a technical level and domain modeling on a strategic level
Hands-on knowledge about serverless-first solutions
2+ years of development experience using Spark (or Hadoop)
1+ years of development experience with Kafka
2+ years of hands-on experience with AWS big data, analytics, and serverless
Excellent English skills
optional_section:
Experience in large-scale enterprise IT environments
Kubernetes: not as a holy grail but as yet another tool that we might use sometimes
Contributed to open source: Make the world happy with those green dots on GitHub!SQL, Postgres, or Oracle is preferred

Knowledge of NoSQL databases, such as MongoDB, Cassandra, HBase, etc.
Knowledge of data visualisation tools, such as D3.js, GGplot, etc.
Experience in the field of corpus based linguistics.
Experience with alignment models and classification methods.
Experience with data analytics over big datasets, non-structured databases as well as data lakes.

company_name: Fortum Marketing and Sales Polska S.A.
responsibilities_section:
Rozwój technik i narzędzi do raportowania i optymalizacji aktualnych procesów raportowych.
Rozliczanie prowizji sprzedażowych z wykorzystaniem CRM i systemu billingowego spółki.
Przygotowywanie zestawień, raportów i analiz cyklicznych oraz ad-hoc m.in. z zakresu analizy rentowności, struktury produktowej i portfela klientów spółki.
Analiza i raportowanie ryzyk związanych z dostawą energii i gazu do portfela klientów spółki.
requirements_section:
Bardzo dobra znajomość MS Excel w szczególności Power Query oraz umiejętności pisania makr w VBA.
Dobra znajomość języka SQL.
Dobry angielski w mowie i piśmie.
Wysoka dbałość o szczegóły i umiejętności analityczne.
Doświadczenie w pracy na dużych zbiorach danych.
Samodzielność w rozwiązywaniu zagadnień analitycznych oraz umiejętność podejmowania decyzji.
optional_section: Znajomość języka Python i/lub innych oraz narzędzi Power BI oraz wiedza z zakresu rynku energii i gazu w Polsce.

position_name: Cloud DevOps Architect / Cloud DevOps Engineer
responsibilities_section:
projektowanie, wdrażanie i rozwijanie procesów CI/CD u naszych klientów
branie udziału w projektach w obszarze chmury publicznej, hybrydowej oraz multicloud
współpraca z zespołami deweloperskimi oraz operacyjnymi klienta
dzielenie się wiedzą oraz doświadczeniem i promowanie DevOpsowego mindsetu
współpraca z najlepszymi specjalistami na rynku
praca z technologicznymi “buzzwordami”
automatyzowanie powoływania infrastruktury i deploymentu aplikacji z wykorzystaniem procesów CI/CD
rozwijanie się zawodowo, uczestnicząc w najciekawszych i najbardziej innowacyjnych projektach na rynku, realizowanych dla klientów będących liderami w swoich branżach w Polsce i na świecie
requirements_section:
Jesteś idealnym kandydatem/kandydatką jeśli masz doświadczenie w jednym lub więcej z poniższych obszarów:
wdrażaniu pryncypiów i praktyk DevOps u klientów
pracy z przynajmniej jedną chmurą publiczną (Azure, AWS, GCP)
projektowaniu, wdrażaniu lub migracji usług do chmury publicznej
prezentowaniu koncepcji architektury DevOps w ramach zespołu oraz przed klientem
projektowaniu i wdrażaniu narzędzi i procesów CI/CD (Gitlab CI, Jenkins, Argo CD, GitHub Actions)
projektowaniu i implementacji Landing Zone;
automatyzacji powoływania infrastruktury (Terraform, ARM, Cloud Formation) oraz zarządzaniu konfiguracją (Ansible, Puppet, Chef)
Ze względu na międzynarodowy charakter projektów (z uwzględnieniem klientów z obszaru UK) wymagamy znajomości języka angielskiego minimum na poziomie B2/C1
optional_section:
certyfikacja na poziomie professional z wybranej przez Ciebie technologii lub chmury publicznej
wiedza z zakresu strategii migracji środowisk do chmury - włączając w to znajomość narzędzi wspierających proces oceny i migracji aplikacji
doświadczenie w pisaniu skryptów (Bash, Python, GoLang)
praktyka w obszarze konteneryzacji i platform orkiestracji (Docker, Kubernetes, Openshift, Rancher)
znajomość architektury aplikacji (np. mikroserwisy)
doświadczenie w pracy w metodyce Agile, Scrum

position_name: Cloud DevOps Architect / Cloud DevOps Engineer
responsibilities_section:
projektowanie, wdrażanie i rozwijanie procesów CI/CD u naszych klientów
branie udziału w projektach w obszarze chmury publicznej, hybrydowej oraz multicloud
współpraca z zespołami deweloperskimi oraz operacyjnymi klienta
dzielenie się wiedzą oraz doświadczeniem i promowanie DevOpsowego mindsetu

praca z technologicznymi “buzzwordami”
automatyzowanie powoływania infrastruktury i deploymentu aplikacji z wykorzystaniem procesów CI/CD

requirements_section:
Jesteś idealnym kandydatem/kandydatką jeśli masz doświadczenie w jednym lub więcej z poniższych obszarów:

responsibilities_section: Depends on the project which you will choose
requirements_section:
Fluent with Python (3+ years of exp)
Fluent with Django (similar python based web frameworks would be a plus)
Strong knowledge and hands-on experience with React (2+ years)
Strong experience with AWS
Strong knowledge of OOP and design patterns
Solid understanding of relational databases and NoSQL databases
Experience with Flask and FastAPI would be a plus
Ability to work all the way from high-level architecture design down to efficient code
Good command of English, both written and spoken, as you’ll be communicating with clients directly
Strong organizational skills — ability to work full-time remotely with no supervision
Responsibility — we want to trust you
Soft skills — we value clear and effective communication, at the same time don't force you becoming a public speaker

position_name: Supervisor / Assistant Manager - Data Science (Deal Advisory Transaction Services)
responsibilities_section:
automatyzacja wewnętrznych procesów w wykorzystaniem ML
przeprowadzanie analiz dużych zbiorów danych (w tym danych finansowych), wyciąganie wniosków oraz wizualizacja wyników
projektowanie, tworzenie i utrzymanie aplikacji biznesowych oraz interaktywnych raportów
wsparcie zespołu w codziennej pracy w ramach prowadzonych projektów i zadań
kontakt z osobami zaangażowanymi w projekt ze strony klienta, ekspertami branżowymi oraz pracownikami innych biur KPMG na całym świecie
requirements_section:
wykształcenie wyższe – preferowane kierunki w zakresie matematyki, informatyki, ekonometrii, Big Data lub pokrewne
minimum 3 lata doświadczenia w Data Science / Machine Learning
doświadczenie w zbieraniu wymagań biznesowych oraz tłumaczeniu ich na proces analityczny
doświadczenie w analizie danych finansowo-księgowych
umiejętność programowania w języku Python
znajomość bibliotek analitycznych DS/ML librarie
umiejętność obróbki danych do postaci recordu analitycznego (ABT / CAR) z wykorzystaniem SQL / Pandas / PySpark
umiejętność krytycznego myślenia oraz samodzielność w konstruowaniu wniosków z przeprowadzonych prac oraz analiz
biegła znajomość języka angielskiego
optional_section: znajomość Alteryxa

location:
Zamknięta 10, Podgórze, Kraków
Kraków, Lesser Poland
type_of_work: full office work, home office work, hybrid work
required_technologies:
Python
Django
Flask
FastAPI
Git
Docker
AWS
JavaScript
Vue.js
React.js
NoSQL
responsibilities_section:
Work with the latest releases of frameworks and libraries (we like being up-to-date)
Apply your Python 3 + knowledge to real-world enterprise software solutions
Have a meaningful impact on projects – analyze requirements, functional specifications, and recommend improvements
Use your full skillset & experience to bridge gaps between backend and frontend technologies (React, Vue)
Bring innovation to the projects, refactor existing codebase to drive up code quality, and ease future functionality (Wind of change vibes? Yes, please!)
Work with ambitious, amazing teams across organizational boundaries (business, DevOps, QA, PM) – you can really learn from everyone here!
Work in line with the highest coding standards, release quality code backed by proven testing techniques
Drive processes that improve software delivery and cost efficiency while reducing risk
Be at the heart of the project, provide daily problem-solving and estimations of work
requirements_section:
Experience using Python in enterprise-grade apps
Strong command of any of Django, Flask, FastAPI knowledge and principles
Expertise in independent estimation for projects and features
Competence to select appropriate technologies and architectural solutions for given requirements
Ability to understand and analyze the project needs
Knowledge of Unit testing, Git version control, Docker
Good understanding of Serverless, AWS technologies, and practices
Experience with building websites with modern Javascript libraries like VueJS, ReactJS
Excellent understanding of relational and NoSQL databases
Anttetion to detail to detail (did you spot the typo? 10 points for you!)
Ability to write clean, well-documented, efficient code, with knowledge of performance optimization
Knowledge of English at least at a B2 level
Drive for knowledge and development
optional_section: Leadership, mentorship skills

responsibilities_section:
Build and maintain new commodity stress tests in the risk system (Numerix Ovam / SAP BW).
Analyze the drivers of the group’s commodity VaR movements (using a historical VaR): from position changes, changing price levels, and changing correlation.
Build and maintain VaR backtests for the derivative books.
Support the central monitoring of the risk and P&L of derivative books.
Maintain P&L reports and analyze the P&L drivers.
Build reports and tools to monitor the risk of the books with what-if-analysis, greeks, etc.
Set up performance reports in alignment with the trading teams, showing the risk-adjusted performance, VaR limit utilization, etc.
Support the group risk team in setting up a new governance framework for Cash Flow risk.
Work with the IM / IT department to maintain and develop BC’s risk infrastructure.
Supporting activities: reconcile the positions in the risk system (Numerix) with the source system (SAP and Polomas), automate this process, and set up new traders, strategies, and derivative instruments in the risk system.

Fluent in English.
Either work experience in financial risk management or good statistical knowledge (knowing what a standard deviation is etc.).
Flair for financial risk, ideally with experience in risk monitoring of derivatives, foreign exchange, or commodities.
Strong in Excel or more advanced calculation tools (Python, R, Matlab, or similar).
Strong capabilities in MS Office and experience in SAP BW and Power BI are a plus.
Analytical mindset.
Curiosity to understand positions and potential risks.

Independent, able to embrace cross-functional support
Proactive nature with good communication skills, numerate, well organized

responsibilities_section:
You will eliminate traditional infrastructure in favor of database services managed in the public cloud and/or those based on Kubernetes,
This is a process that won't happen right away, so you will also have to take care of the existing database infrastructure so that it runs smoothly and is always available,
At the same time, you will create and maintain tools to improve, optimize and automate tasks in our infrastructure.
requirements_section:
Have knowledge of MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle in the field of database administration,
Are familiar with as many as possible tools supporting the above technologies (PMM, percona-toolkit, pg_repack, Grid Control, RMAN, simpana, etc.),
Have knowledge of the GNU stack - bash, grep, awk, sed, as well as, of the Python language (as we create many services from simple scripts that automate backup / restore actions to complex data integrations based on the more advanced frameworks like flask or django)
optional_section:
Familiarity with Docker and Kubernetes,
Some knowledge of the database services in GCP (preferred) or Azure

Thinking in systems and exploring opportunities to improve and streamline end-to-end processes by transforming abstract concepts into working solutions
Partnering with product owners, engineers, data scientists, and data analysts to develop a seamless data platform
Designing, building, and launching extremely efficient and reliable data infrastructure to move data across a number of platforms including Data Lake and Data Warehouse
Communicating, at scale, through multiple mediums, like dashboards, bots and more
Leveraging data and business principles to solve large scale web, mobile, and data infrastructure problems
Ensuring consistent standards and quality in the data platform ecosystem
Supporting and training new and existing users of the platform
Creating and maintaining a company-wide data registry and documentation
Coming up with and enforcing best practices for coding, testing, deployment, and maintenance
Planning and implementing complex platform changes that involve stakeholders across the whole organisation
Automating and simplifying existing processes to ease life of fellow engineers
requirements_section:
A Bachelor's or Master's in Computer Science or related field (or equivalent industry experience)
Fluency in Python, SQL, Unix Shell
Experience applying agile software development technical practices (TDD, refactoring, CI/CD, XP)
Experience in custom ETL design, implementation, and maintenance
Experience with workflow orchestrators, such as Airflow
Experience working with Big Data/MPP analytics platform (i.e. Exasol, Amazon Redshift, Google BigQuery, or similar)
optional_section:
Experience building large-scale infrastructure applications
The ability to write easily understandable and maintainable code in multiple programming languages
Experience with commercial cloud providers (e.g. GCP, AWS)

Experience building data platforms using Spark, Trino/Presto, Flink, Hive, or similar
Experience with monitoring and logging tools NewRelic, Grafana, Prometheus, ELK
Experience implementing data mesh principles

location:
Puszkarska 7m, Podgórze Duchackie, Kraków
Kraków, Lesser Poland
responsibilities_section:
Support network infrastructure in cloud environments (Azure, GCP, and AWS)
Support on-premise infrastructure supporting cloud environments (Cisco FTD, Nexus, etc.)
Support of SASE network infrastructure
Support and administration of hybrid firewall environments (cloud and on-premise) in line with GTS security policy
Updating job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities, reading professional publications, maintaining personal networks and participating in professional organizations
Report network operational status by gathering and prioritizing information and managing projects
Remotely support on-site engineers and end users/customers during the installation
Remotely troubleshooting and fault finding if issues occur upon initial installation/configuration
Speak with customers via email and phone for initial requirement capture
Undertake data network fault investigations in the local, wide area, and cloud environments, using information from multiple sources
Secure network systems by establishing and enforcing policies, and defining and monitoring access
Upgrade data network equipment and virtual appliances to the latest stable firmware releases
Configurate routing and switching equipment
Perform capacity management and audit of IP addressing and hosted devices within data centers and cloud environments
requirements_section:
3+ years of cloud network engineering experience with Azure, GCP, and/or AWS
5 years of IT experience
Strong attention to detail, problem-solving skills, and verbal/written communication (with both technical and non-technical audiences)
Skills in the following areas of cloud infrastructure: Virtual gateways (IPSec, ExpressRoute, Partner Interconnect, etc.); Virtual routers (Cloud-native and third party); Virtual networks (VNets, VPCs, etc.); Peering between virtual networks; Multi-cloud networking tools experience (i.e. Aviatrix); Security mechanisms (e.g. NSGs, firewalls, cloud armor, etc.); Load balancing
Skills in the following areas of routing and switching: Data Center infrastructure solutions: Cisco (R&S), ASA/Firepower (NSFW+IDS/IPS), Infoblox (DDI), Citrix Netscaler, Cisco ISE and global scale LAN and WAN solutions, also implemented on Cisco products, network segmentation and access control in remote offices; Deep understanding of methods of NAT in cloud and on-premise environments
Comprehensive knowledge which includes solutions analysis, design, deployment and operationalization in the following areas: SASE and SD-WAN technologies; Programming/scripting languages and frameworks knowledge and experience, in support of automation (e.g. Python, Ansible, Terraform)
Additional experience in one or more of the following which includes solutions analysis, design, deployment and operationalization: Network Automation & Orchestration; IaaS, PaaS, & SaaS; Public Cloud/Hybrid Cloud inclusive of integration of solutions across these platforms; Virtualization in the network, security and overall infrastructure space
Proven ability to implement, maintain, and support local and remote portions of a global enterprise network
Ability to create and maintain detailed technical documentation of all moves, adds, and changes regarding the wide-area network
Ability to solve practical problems and carry out responsibilities under general supervision
Ability to evaluate existing communications systems, identify deficiencies, and make network performance recommendations
Ability to organize workload for effective implementation
Ability to interact effectively at all levels with sensitivity to cultural diversity
Certificates / Training nice to have: CCNA, CCNP, Azure Network Associate
Command of the English language (min. B2)

position_name: Ekspert ds. Ryzyka Aktuarialnego i Modelowania Aktuarialnego
responsibilities_section:
Współtworzenie i rozwijanie modeli aktuarialnych do wyznaczania wymogu kapitałowego za pomocą modelu wewnętrznego w zakresie ryzyka aktuarialnego
Weryfikacja poprawności i przygotowanie danych wejściowych do modeli aktuarialnych
Przygotowywanie narzędzi aktuarialnych na podstawie zdefiniowanych założeń na potrzeby wyznaczania kapitałowego wymogu wypłacalności za pomocą modelu wewnętrznego
Współtworzenie oraz walidacja metodyk modeli aktuarialnych
requirements_section:
Min. 3 letnie doświadczenie w obszarze aktuariatu, ryzyka lub finansów
Umiejętność tworzenia modeli ryzyk aktuarialnych lub chęć rozwoju w tym kierunku
Znajomość zagadnień związanych z BEL oraz kalkulacją SCR
Znajomość przepisów prawa w zakresie ubezpieczeń i regulacji dotyczących dyrektywy Solvency II
Biegła znajomość MS Excel i VBA i minimum dobra znajomość SAS i/lub SQL
Wykształcenie wyższe (preferowane kierunki: matematyka, ekonomia, metody ilościowe, informatyka i ekonometria)
Znajomość R lub Python będzie dodatkowym atutem

responsibilities_section: Risk Management Funds Team provides risk management services for liquid and alternative investment funds domiciled in Switzerland, Luxembourg and Ireland. As Alternative Investment Risk Model Developer you will be responsible for development of macroeconomic models for the Alternative Investments area, in particular for direct Real Estate, Private Equity, Private Debt and Infrastructure Investments. You will be in charge of alternative investments assessment by actively using the internal alternative investments software RealEstimate with regards to specific analyses and reports. You will be asked to enhance the Risk Management & Reporting platform used for calculation of quantitative risk measures and valuation of complex deals. In addition, you will closely coordinate with the risk analyst team and participate in projects within liquid strategy funds area (market-, credit-, liquidity risk assessment).
requirements_section:
University degree in Mathematics, Econometrics, Finance or equivalent post graduate studies (CAIA, CFA, FRM or similar education would be an asset).
Experience in a risk management or investment analytics role within banking and/or capital market industry.
Good understanding of financial instruments and investment funds, including derivatives. Knowledge in the area of alternative investments like Real Estate, Private Equity, Private Debt and Infrastructure would be an asset.
Programming skills in R (Python programming skills and familiarity with SQL databases would be an asset).
Good quantitative skills, analytical mindset, data analysis skills.
Performance oriented problem solver with hands-on mentality and the ability to manage work independently.
Good organization and communication skills.
Proficiency in written and spoken English.
Understanding the value of diversity in the workplace and is dedicated to fostering an inclusive culture in all aspects of working life so that people from all backgrounds receive equal treatment, realize their full potential and can bring their full, authentic selves to work.
Dedication to fostering an inclusive culture and value diverse perspectives

responsibilities_section:

Excellent communication and presentation skills, capable of effectively conveying complex modeling results to technical and non-technical audiences.

Strong data visualization skills to represent complex data relationships.

Familiarity with Excel, PowerPoint, as well as the ability to quickly adapt to new tools and technologies.

responsibilities_section:
• Key skills: Enterprise java, microservice based architectures, IoC frameworks like SpringBoot and experience achieving the same thing with vanilla java. GKE and AWS are useful as is experience with single branch development and pipelines supporting intra hour prod releases. Python for one of them would be a nice to have.
• Onboarding Data Services (ODS): is a suit of microservices, used in the wholesale bank to manage STP data collection for new customers and ongoing KYC and CDD review for existing customers. ODS does not have a front end and the business logic it applies to the data collection templates is rendered in channels e.g. SmartServe.

responsibilities_section:
Collaborating with business stakeholders, subject matter experts, and technical teams to understand business processes, and requirements for various initiatives
Identifying areas for process improvement through data-driven insights, and making recommendations to internal stakeholders
Documenting, and formalizing business, and data requirements using industry-standard methodologies, and tools
Identifying data requirements, and specifications that accurately reflect business needs, and support underlying processes
Collaborating with software developers, and data architects to ensure alignment between data architecture, software designs, and business requirements

Identifying, and mitigating risks related to process redundancy, data quality, data security, compliance, and privacy considerations
Working with governance committees to ensure adherence to enterprise policies, standards, and guidelines
Participating in testing, and validation activities to ensure requirements are met, and systems function as intended
Continuously monitoring, and assessing evolving business needs, and goals to ensure alignment with requirements, and designs
Providing support, and guidance to project managers, software developers, and other stakeholders in implementing data requirements
Developing visualizations, and reports to present data insights for informed business decision-making
Collaborating with data architects, data engineering, and cross-functional teams to support data-driven decision-making processes
Supporting data-related tasks such as data mapping, data lineage, data governance, data quality, and metadata management
Defining user acceptance tests
Applying practical experience of the agile change lifecycle, and the BA role within it
Comfortably working in cross-skilled delivery teams, collaborating with UX, developers, testers, and delivery personnel
Keeping up-to-date with industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in data analytics
requirements_section:
7+ years of experience in a Business Analyst role
Experience in: Software front-end design, change management, and review of test cases/UAT, Working with JIRA, and creating process flows, UAT or review of test cases, and active participation in the testing phase, Working in a collaborative team environment, and ability to work independently
Knowledge of: Agile methodologies like Scrum or Kanban, including sprint planning, backlog grooming, and daily stand-ups, Data modeling, database design, and data management principles, Data governance principles, best practices, and regulatory requirements
Proficiency in exploring, and understanding requirements, and data to propose or enhance business processes
Familiarity with data visualization, and business intelligence tools such as Tableau or Qlik
Ability to design, and propose dashboards, and KPIs to provide insights into key business metrics
Proficiency in presentation tools like PowerPoint, and diagramming tools such as Visio or Visual Paradigm
Familiarity with industry-standard data modeling methodologies, and software development practices
Strong presentation skills to effectively communicate with senior executive stakeholders, and non-technical team members
Strong analytical, and problem-solving skills, with the ability to work with complex data sets

Fluent English
